VIEWS, pREvIEws
ANo Reviews


Edward Banks

Martin r. Deany born Charestown Virginia ow West
Vgina May TO- 1872 His ancestry is raceable his fathers
African chief the Golah tribe and his mothers
Manngo princess. In Charlestown he had little
uny However, teacher instructed him privately
spite the law In this way he learned read and wre


In his mother moved Chambersburg, Pennsylvania
school without being moested In 1881
they Pittsburgh for better opportunities Then he studied
Louis Woodson, who in addition serving there
African Methodist Episcopal preacher maintained good school,


Dany travelled and eced for the emancipation the Negro
with the anslavery organizations In Ohio he
mobbed Finally he that the Negroes doomed have
many troubles in this in the North After the Fugitive
1850 passed. he thought that the Negroes would
probably by going foreign shore He moved
Chatham, Canada in 1885, and pracced medicine here but in
1859 New York Africa acqan himself with
country thought might make for the
Negroes from the United States He visited
kings made treaties with Them back his country
believing that something should be done transplant Negroes to
place Liberia His presented
only circles of forward-ookng people the
United States those in Europe especially in England The
coming O Civil War upset the project

This is the second issue beginning our
seventh year of publication Of the Arizona
T1ibu,,e It MARES our SIX SUCCESSFUL years
ACCOMPLISHED through the combined etorts
of me and my uite. Countless hours haze oeem
spent in our teamwork to bring you not just
another newspaper, but the best one that our
iqdivid1al abilities and talents couId pTod~ce.


We haze ende0Uoyed to bring you all SIDES
of the news, local and national. We pledged
ouvselves to bring you the efforts Of our beo-
pie, big and small. We haze not catered to any
one person or group and ne shall MAINTAIN
an objective view of the news and events


which NE report.


From time to time the Arizona Tribune has
been called the destroyer Of community hoY-
7uony. We claim and haze byoven that there IS
little harmony ,s0hen there. is great deaL0t>
dissatisJa ction. Naturally there exists those
men and women Who would stifle the facts IN
order to permit harmony to remain on the
surface. WI
+ You the faithful readers and advertisers
haze encouraged us by continuing to support
US. We look forward to anOthey happy birth
d0v. Thanks million.

During the past year a new
quartet of long hairedyoung Eng
lishmen have invaded the musical
world of the good old U.S.A.
They have usurped the sovereign
territory Of Elvis, Frankie,
Chubby and Bobby. They have the
young girls crying and squeal-
ing. The Beatles have started
mania. Everyone has been af-
fected one way or another.


Their appearances here caused
more excitement than the Eddie
Liz-Dickie idyll. The policemen
were hardpressed at every city
to restrain the femmes who want
ed to grab them. Frankly, can
see little that should appeal to
the femmes unless it is true
the lads look like they need moth
ering.


After listening to some of their
songs. however, | must admit
their renditions have wuick
tempo which appeals to young
bloods. The Beatles have
amassed several millions of that
green stuff while rolling their
limpid orbs and singing their
long tresses-so who | am to say
that they aren't great7


Enough about the two legged
Beatles-we are plagued with the
smaller forms now. The beetles
invaded our home this June dur
ing the last week and they have
repealed all kinds of sprays and
powders. The only sure way to
stop one is to step on it.


The pest control man said the
Valley was having an invasion Of
beetles and this type Is called
darling. fail to see any humor
in calling a BEETLE darling. Per-
haps, the scientist who named
the species wanted to call it
the opposite of darling and his
superiors refused to include his
label in the list.


The darling beetles crawl up
the walls, they find their way in
the house when dusk approaches.
They flee to the outer walls of
the house when sprinkle the lawn
or wash the driveway.


Getting very disguised one day,
purchased can of insect spray
and sprayed in all the cracks and
crevices | could find. The next
evening more beetles appeared.
l seemed to be the only being
suffering from the effects Of the
spray.


There we're a few crickets this
summer but few in comparison
with previous seasons. A grayish
insect called the sour bug &C
companied the beetles, but they
we're promptly killed by the two
applications from the pest con-
troll guns.


| have thought of new way
to rid the Valley of the Sun
of the BEETLES. Let's wire the
human Beatles and invite them
to present concerts on the four
sides of the city and see if the
beetles will run into the irriga-
ton waste canals.


1t would be new twist to the old
story of the Pied Piper of Hame-
lin. Then those Beatles could
rave about the way they sent those
crazy, wild darling beetles.


Wonder who could foot the
Beatles' bill7

Sights und Sounds
ELOIse BANKS

Beetles Needed
